1:
Hear my prayer, Yahweh;\q hear my cry to you.
\q
2:
Do not hide your face from me in my time of trouble.\q Listen to me.
\q When I call out to you, answer me quickly.


\q
3:
For my days pass away like smoke,\q and my bones burn like fire.
\q
4:
My heart is crushed, and I am like grass that has withered.\q I forget to eat any food.


\q
5:
With my continual groaning,\q I have become very thin.
\q
6:
I am like a pelican of the wilderness;\q I have become like an owl in the ruins.


\q
7:
I lie awake like a solitary bird,\q alone on the housetop.
\q
8:
My enemies taunt me all day long;\q those who mock me use my name in curses.


\q
9:
I eat ashes like bread\q and mix my drink with tears.
\q
10:
Because of your raging anger,\q you have lifted me up to throw me down.


\q
11:
My days are like a shadow that fades,\q and I have withered like grass.
\q
12:
But you, Yahweh, live forever,\q and your fame is for all generations.


\q
14:
For your servants hold her stones dear\q and feel compassion for the dust of her ruins.
\q
15:
The nations will respect your name, Yahweh,\q and all the kings of the earth will honor your glory.
\q
16:
Yahweh will rebuild Zion\q and will appear in his glory.


\q
17:
At that time, he will respond to the prayer of the destitute;\q he will not reject their prayer.
\q
18:
This will be written for future generations,\q and a people not yet born will praise Yahweh.


\q
19:
For he has looked down from the holy heights;\q from heaven Yahweh has viewed the earth,
\q
20:
to hear the groaning of the prisoners,\q to release those who were condemned to death.


\q
21:
Then men will proclaim the name of Yahweh in Zion\q and his praise in Jerusalem
\q
22:
when the peoples and kingdoms gather together\q to serve Yahweh.


\q
23:
He has taken away my strength in the middle of life.\q He has shortened my days.
\q
24:
I said, "My God, do not take me away in the middle of life;\q you are here throughout all generations.


\q
25:
In ancient times you set the earth in place;\q the heavens are the work of your hands.
\q
27:
But you are the same,\q and your years will have no end.


\q
28: The children of your servants will live on,\q and their descendants will live in your presence."
